The Thoroughbreds and Table Two

I am currently on a quest to get all the monsters in the game (except octochrome, of course) and I was wondering if anyone could explain the "Table 2" used for getting Whitehound and Serket.

By Pattongeneral on Thursday, June 23, 2005 - 12:08 pm:

By Pattongeneral on Thursday, June 23, 2005 - 03:49 pm:

Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive: The Shrine (Passwords and Unlocking): Special Breeds and Legendary Breeds: SP-L: Thoroughbreds (Mocchi, Tiger, Arrowhead)

The author, GoldenBoy, shows two methods for making a thoroughbred: one solo, one with a partner. The second table (partners) is the one that confuses me. If it could be explained, that would be great.

By Infernus on Thursday, June 23, 2005 - 08:32 pm:

I don't really understand Table 2, as I don't know how the game works through the link cable (looks like a monster trade/duplication set-up to me), but I can still help you with Serket.

In the case of Serket, you follow the same pattern (on Table 1), but the Arrowheads do not have to be raised - only the Joker does. This was proved a while back but has not been edited in...yet.

By Pattongeneral on Thursday, June 23, 2005 - 11:45 pm:

Ok, thanks

It seemed to me that when two peple combined a monster, if that's possible, then they oth got one. I wouldn't know yet because I haven't linked up with anyone before.

By Thorr on Friday, July 22, 2005 - 05:47 am:

When you combine via Link cable, both players receive identical monsters as a result.

By Thorr on Friday, July 22, 2005 - 05:57 am:

When Goldenboy and I made the tables, we traded monsters via link cable to make table 2. It's faster because you don't have to raise 2 monsters yourself.
Basically, I raise monster 1 and my partner raises monster 2. We combine them using the link and we BOTH get a 2nd gen monster. (Savings of 1 monster and the time it takes to raise it..)
Then, we do that AGAIN. (Savings of 1 more monster and the time...)
Now we both have 2 2nd gen monsters. If I take one of them and combine via Link, I get a 3rd gen monster. Then we do it again and get another 3rd gen monster. Now we both have 2 third gen monsters instantly out of 2 2nd gen monsters. That's a BIG savings.
Now we can each combine our 3rd gen monsters to make a thoroughbred legend.
This is ESPECIALLY usefull when you have to raise the monsters to a certain class. It will save you toms of time.
